hero.subtitle: I'm an Argentina-based Software Engineering Student and Full-Stack Developer focused on developing clean, user-friendly, and fast experiences.

footer.made_by: Made with <svg class="mx-1" style="width:24px;height:24px" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path class="text-background_light dark:text-background_dark" fill="currentColor" d="M12,21.35L10.55,20.03C5.4,15.36 2,12.27 2,8.5C2,5.41 4.42,3 7.5,3C9.24,3 10.91,3.81 12,5.08C13.09,3.81 14.76,3 16.5,3C19.58,3 22,5.41 22,8.5C22,12.27 18.6,15.36 13.45,20.03L12,21.35Z" /></svg> by Gonzalo Hirsch

about.top: I'm a full-stack developer with more than three years of professional experience working on front-end and back-end projects. I have a passion for technology, incredible ideas, and teaching programming.
about.bottom: I study Software Engineering at the Instituto Tecnológico de Buenos Aires (ITBA) and work as a Full-Stack Freelancer at Toptal. I'm also the first and former vice president and co-founder of IEEE's Computer Society ITBA Argentina branch here in Buenos Aires, Argentina.

passion.text: My passion is building reliable, efficient software and experiences.

winston.description: The Winston Project is a digital marketing consulting company based in New York, United States. Developed websites with fast development cycles for different US Universities using Gridsome (Vue.js) and Hugo (Go), and Tailwind CSS.

toptal.description: Member of the Toptal community under the Core (Full-Stack) specialization.

cs.description: In collaboration with the other founder grew the leadership team of the society from two to twenty people. Managed multiple teams to ensure events were carried out and sponsors contacted. Designed and taught two courses at the university: Introduction to Python and Django REST APIs.

newcombin.description: Developed and designed an API for a digital payments platform (Java and AWS Services) and created a companion app for that platform (Apache Cordova and Vue.js). Developed a simple eCommerce app for a subscription magazine (C#, .NET, and ASP). Designed and managed databases for applications. Developed a mobile application to implement a proof-of-work system for a company.

django.company: Programming REST APIs in Python with Django
django.description: Designed and taught a course on how to create and develop REST APIs using Python and Django. The classes had approximately 100 attendants.

python.description: Taught a course (during multiple semesters) on an introduction to programming in Python. The classes had approximately 200 attendants.

contact.title: Let’s Build Together
contact.message: If you have something cool you want to work on or have a project in mind, send me an email or contact me on my social networks.

redirect.title: Redirect API
redirect.description:
An API similar to bit.ly but under my domain (redirect.gonzalohirsch.com) used to add custom redirects to pages I want. It was built as a hobby using AWS services such as API Gateway, Lambda, DynamoDB, CloudFront, Route 53, and CloudWatch. Some example URLs are:
  • Toptal redirect
  • Github redirect
  • LinkedIn redirect

this_site.title: Personal Webpage
this_site.description: This website is my portfolio, built using Vue.js and TailwindCSS as frontend frameworks. This page is hosted in an AWS S3 bucket, distributed using AWS CloudFront, and has DNS using AWS Route 53. All components are custom and natively made entirely using Vue and Tailwind. I included the ability to switch between light mode and dark mode, which is an incredible feature. This choice, stored in a cookie, is used to remember the user's decision.

playground_site.title: Playground Webpage
playground_site.description: A custom website, under a subdomain, that I use as a playground for tests. This site is currently a playground for tests using Tailwind CSS and some cool animations created with the framework.

ai_ml.title: AI and ML
ai_ml.description: This repository contains implementations of multiple Neural Network designs and some search algorithms such as A*. Each codebase focuses on solving a particular problem. Neural Network designs are single perceptron, multilayer perceptron, Kohonen network, Oja network, and Autoencoders.
